data.title: Uncaught Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, open 'C:\work\...\text-buffer.js:1020'
data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Copy/paste new files over old files.
2. Try to save in Atom, get red box of depression.
3. Open and save in Visual Studio, get dialog box to save or overwrite, click overwrite.
4. Now can save in Atom.

**Atom Version**: 1.0.7
**System**: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, open 'C:\work...\dashboard.html'

```
At C:\Users\mibrahim\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.7\resources\app.asar\node_modules\text-buffer\lib\text-buffer.js:1020

Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, open 'C:\work\...\dashboard.html'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.openSync (fs.js:544:18)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as openSync] (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:118:20)
    at Object.fs.writeFileSync (fs.js:1155:15)
    at Object.fsPlus.writeFileSync (C:\Users\mibrahim\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.7\resources\app.asar\node_modules\fs-plus\lib\fs-plus.js:279:17)
    at File.module.exports.File.writeFileSync (C:\Users\mibrahim\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.7\resources\app.asar\node_modules\pathwatcher\lib\file.js:273:19)
    at File.module.exports.File.writeFileWithPrivilegeEscalationSync (C:\Users\mibrahim\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.7\resources\app.asar\node_modules\pathwatcher\lib\file.js:371:21)
    at File.module.exports.File.writeSync (C:\Users\mibrahim\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.7\resources\app.asar\node_modules\pathwatcher\lib\file.js:345:12)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.saveAs (C:\Users\mibrahim\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.7\resources\app.asar\node_modules\text-buffer\lib\text-buffer.js:1011:19)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.save (C:\Users\mibrahim\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.7\resources\app.asar\node_modules\text-buffer\lib\text-buffer.js:992:19)
```

data.title: activationHooks grammar-used does not activate package when running specs
data.body:
In Atom 1.0.7, the specs in https://atom.io/packages/markdown-folder can no longer be executed. They all timeout in waitsForPromise, probably due to the fact that the markdown-folder package is never loaded. 

In package.json:

```
"activationHooks": [
    "language-gfm:grammar-used"
  ],
```

In spec:

```
  beforeEach ->
    workspaceElement = atom.views.getView(atom.workspace)
    activationPromise = atom.packages.activatePackage('markdown-folder')
    waitsForPromise ->
      activationPromise
    waitsForPromise ->
      atom.workspace.open('test.md')
```

The activationPromise never completes, so all spec tests timeout after 5000 ms.

The exact same code and spec used to work fine in the Atom version that was the latest in mid-July 2015. 

Tested in Atom 1.0.7 on Max OSX. 
In normal use situations (when editing a markdown file), the markdown-folder is activated and works fine.

data.title: Document MenuItem `enabled` and `visible`
data.body:
The Electron MenuItem[1] `enabled` and `visible` options are exposed to
Atom context menus in menu_helpers.coffee[2] but are not yet documented.
Both options are passed through to Electron.

[1] http://electron.atom.io/docs/v0.31.0/api/menu-item/
[2] https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/v1.0.7/src/menu-helpers.coffee#L49

data.title: Setting associations with arbitrary files on Windows is problematic due to Squirrel
data.body:
Currently it installs in the "user\appdata\Local\" folder. Atom needs to change its installation directory to either "C:\program files" or "C:\program files (x86)".

Whenever I encounter a text file with a new extension, I (of course) want to make it open by default with Atom. To chose Atom as a default program, I manually have to dig down to the .exe file, which is located here:  "user\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.0.7\atom.exe" The problem here lies with the .exe file sitting inside a folder with a version number. Whenever Atom updates, the whole default program shortcut breaks.

Solution:
1) Make Atom install into Program Files
2) Delete old versions when updating Atom
3) Don't place the version number in the folder name
4) If people want to roll back, they can download previous versions from github.

data.title: Atom sometimes doesn't load the project on window reload in dev mode
data.body:
I haven't found solid reproduction steps for this, but sometimes when I'm working on an Atom package, Atom doesn't reload the project after a window reload. It makes working on packages a real pain, because I have to open the project folder from Atom again and again. Here's what I do: 1. `cd` to project dir, e.g. `cd ~/projects/atom/minimap-codeglance` 2. `apm link -d` 3. `atom -d` 4. Make some edits to some files 5. Run `window:reload` command with keybinding ctrl-alt-r (haven't tested running it from the command palette or the menu) 6. **BUG** (doesn't happen all the time) Atom opens an empty window, no tree view, no open files, nothing. I can open the project I was working on with ctrl-shift-o and all is fine.
**Expected** Atom opens the project folder I was working on, shows it in the tree view and opens files that were open when I hit reload. This is using Atom 1.0.8-a8e80a2 on Debian 9 I'll let you know if I find 100% reproduction steps.

data.body:
Repro:
1. Open the root of a git repo in atom 
2. Create a new file in one of the directories
3. Notice that directory becomes green in the tree-view
4. Remove the new file
5. EXPECT the directory to not be green
6. OBSERVE it is still green

data.title: IME composition with multiple cursors
data.body:
In `text-editor-component.coffee` L249–251 ([here](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/4560914273127105eac7ce2d46bcb8903b972dae/src/text-editor-component.coffee#L249)) the `compositionend` event causes the editor to put back in the text that was in the original selection, except it breaks with multiple cursors. 

Steps to reproduce:
1. have `foobar` in a text editor
2. put cursor before `f` and add a new cursor before `b`
3. press `shift-right`, now you have `f` and `b` selected
4. type a composited text (e.g., on a mac with US keyboard, `alt-e`+`e` to get `é`)
5. you will now have `éooéar` – so far so good, but now do `undo` (`cmd-z`)
6. end up with `boobar` instead of `foobar`

Possibly related to #5414.

data.title: Fix config.get for schemas with objects
data.body:
The config.get method does not return the default values for objects with properties in a config schema.
### Example

For example the editor config has:
(excerpt taken from [config-schema.coffee](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/config-schema.coffee))

``` coffeescript
...
  backUpBeforeSaving:
    type: 'boolean'
    default: false
    description: 'Ensure file contents aren\'t lost if there is an I/O error during save by making a temporary backup copy.'
  invisibles:
    type: 'object'
    properties:
      eol:
        type: ['boolean', 'string']
        default: '\u00ac'
        maximumLength: 1
      space:
        type: ['boolean', 'string']
        default: '\u00b7'
        maximumLength: 1
      tab:
        type: ['boolean', 'string']
        default: '\u00bb'
        maximumLength: 1
      cr:
        type: ['boolean', 'string']
        default: '\u00a4'
        maximumLength: 1
...
```

A call to `atom.config.get('editor')` returns an object with an 'invisibles' value that is an empty object. We are expecting an object containing the default values for the properties in 'invisibles'. 

This result is caused by `_.defaults()` in `@getRawValue()` not being recursive. The lack of a `_.deepDefaults()` lead me to use a bit of a workaround with `_.deepExtends()`. Now with `_.deepExtends()`, the default values are the base while any new values read from the config.cson overwrite the defaults. This way all default values, even nested ones, appear in the result.
### Side-Effect

A side effect of this issue was that atom/settings-view does not properly present the available configuration options from the config schema. The `appendObject()` method in [settings-view/lib/settings-panel.coffee](https://github.com/atom/settings-view/blob/5a115f9e051da32e7af676daf6076d890d8d5e75/lib/settings-panel.coffee) uses the values provided by `config.get(packageName)`. The lack of keys in the value provided to appendObject would lead to objects in the schema disappearing from the SettingsPanel. With this proposed change, the SettingsPanel now properly displays objects and their properties.

See atom/settings-view#386 and atom/settings-view#518.

data.title: Keyboard input from the numeric keypad
data.body: Some European keyboards don't have _Grave Accent_ and _Tilde_ characters. In order to insert these characters it can be dialed the respective ASCII code using the numeric keypad (i.e. `Alt+0096`). Maybe this will work for the US keyboard as well. In Atom this works only if typing in the last line otherwise the cursor jumps 2 lines down. UPDATE: Inserting these characters by switching to the US keyboard seems to work. Setting a shortcut to change the keyboard layout: - Windows: Usually `Ctrl+Shift` is set by default; - Linux: Usually `System Settings` > `Keyboard` > `Shortcuts` > `Typing` > `Switch to next source` to set a custom key; P.S. _Tilde_ ~ and _Grave Accent_ ` are placed on the same button so it's easy to remember.

data.title: Add Search and Replace button in the search
data.body:
I was trying to do a search across all text files in a directory and what I noticed was there was no search button. I know the default search/replace button is the enter button on the keyboard, however there is no text advising that it is so.

What I propose is to add a 'Search' and also a 'Replace' button which would mimic the enter keypress of the respective textboxes in the red area highlighted below. If you look at other text editors, you will see that both methods are provided. Also the textboxes are pretty wide so the buttons can be accomodated without too much hassle UI wise.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3102540/9422930/5253a5f0-48ee-11e5-9c04-0bcb91f4bc7b.png)

Just putting it out there to see if there is a consensus in doing this change.

data.title: Add API for rebuilding native modules of packages
data.body:
This is to support https://github.com/atom/incompatible-packages/pull/9

This PR adds `Package::rebuild()` and `Package::getBuildFailureOutput()` methods, persists build failures, and considers a package incompatible when it has a build failure.

It also changes the storage location of the cached incompatible native modules in local storage so we can distinguish them more easily from build failures, so we should wait to merge this until the Electron upgrade lands which will force us to invalidate the cache anyway.

data.title: Desktop App does not pin correctly in Windows 10
data.body: When you pin the desktop app it creates a separate instance and puts it at the end in the desktop. Whenever you close and re-launch the app it opens up a separate instance and not where you pinned it originally

data.title: Copying Text from Preview Copies Full HTML Instead
data.body:
**Summary**
When working with markdown as a source type, and attempting to copy text from a preview of that markdown content, when I attempt to copy text from within a code block shown in the preview, I get the full html of the preview, instead of the plain text that appeared on screen.

**Configuration**
Mac OS 10.10.4 , Atom 1.0.7 , markdown-preview 0.150.0

**Steps**
1. Open a markdown file in Atom which contains code blocks delimited by three backticks (`)
2. Show the preview of the markdown using the standard markdown-preview (0.150.0) package
3. Select text shown within a code block in the preview pane, and copy
4. Paste into another editor (e.g. TextEdit, BBEdit)

**Expected Behavior**
I expected that when I copy/pasted the text from within the code block, I would get the plain text that I was seeing on screen.

**Problem Behavior**
Instead of being able to copy and paste text from within code blocks shown in markdown-preview, I get the entire html of the rendered markdown file.
